abstract: Alex Crevar travel article on trip to Albania's capital city, Tirana, offering visitors a palpable urban energy that has grown continually since 1991, when more than four decades of authoritarian Communist rule came to an end.
lead_paragraph: The Albanian capital’s brightly colored buildings and palpable energy are indicative of the long way the capital has come since the fall of its Communist regime in 1991.

headline.main: Tirana, Breaking Free From Communist Past, Is a City Transformed
headline.print_headline: In the Heart of the Balkans, a City Transformed

snippet: The Albanian capital’s brightly colored buildings and palpable energy are indicative of the long way the capital has come since the fall of its Communist regime in 1991.
